about_me: I am a developer from Vancouver, BC. I am currently working on a Bachelor of Computer Science (BCS) at the University of British Columbia. I also have a Bachelor of Science (BSc.) from the University of British Columbia with major in Cell Biology and Genetics and a minor in Commerce.

work.title: On-site Coordinator
description: Managed store room of laboratory supplies for labs in the VGH area
Aided customers with supply order inquiries and pricing issues
Organized annual supplier trade shows for the local area

work.title: Operations Assistant
description: Maintained VoIP telephone system for the department using Cisco Unified Communications Manager
Served on building safety committee for 3 years, chaired for 5 months
Created a database in Excel for over 100 pieces of equipment in the building
Supervised events held by external organizations that took place in the building

work.title: Regulated Canadian Immigration Consultant
description: Completed over 40 cases to date with a ~90% success rate

work.title: Regulated Canadian Immigration Consultant
description: Advising clients and their families on different immigration options
Completing and submitting applications to Citizenship and Immigration Canada
Completed over 15 cases to date with a ~90% success rate

work.title: Developer
description: Developing websites and cloud applications for various clients on the Salesforce platform
Using Apex, Visualforce, Javascript to develop dynamic content for both internal and external use for by the client, and by our own company
Thoroughly testing each component we create by ensuring all test cases cover >75% of our code

details: Developed in team of 2 using SVN for version control using the Android SDK and Java in Eclipse
Implemented the functionality to query the locations of randomly generated “friends” from a web server and find bus routes to them using the Translink API
Added the ability to track “friends” on the map and have their locations updated in real-time
Built a website to parse publically available data about electric car charge stations
Integrated Google maps into page for displaying stations
Implemented ability to retrieve and store station information to a database
Built using the Google Web Toolkit and Java in Eclipse
Tested and debugged data parser using JUnit and rest of project using test cases
Developed website to provide guests with information about upcoming wedding using Google Web Toolkit, Java, HTML, CSS using Eclipse
Designed using Bootstrap for GWT
Developed in team of 4 using Agile methodology and GitHub for version control
Designed and built a database to track wedding guests using Oracle SQL*Plus
Oversaw the UI design using Bootstrap to create desktop and mobile layouts
Developed and coded functionality using PHP, HTML, CSS
Tested and debugged application using various test cases
Presented project to the TA after completion
Personal home page with current resume
Designed using Foundation 5 with some Bootstrap elements added
Uses AngularJS to render content
Server implemented using Node.js and Express framework
MySQL used for database
Project for Money 20/20 hackathon in Las Vegas, NV
Created using Node.js, AngularJS, Android SDK and Android Wear SDK
Parents can challenge their children with fitness goals from a website
Goals will show up on the child’s phone and progress is tracked with a smartwatch
Gifts are rewarded to the child using ModoPayments API
Completed in 24 hours with a group of 2 developers and 1 designer
Won a prize worth about $5000.00USD
